definition: to undergo change in weather/restoration of reactionary rule or the previous regime
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: In anticipation of bad weather they took plenty of warm clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他们预料到会变天而带了很多厚衣服。

sentences.english: The weather forecast said it would change this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 预报说今天下午开始变天。

sentences.english: The wind is howling. The weather looks like turning nasty.
sentences.chinese: 风呼呼地刮着，好像要变天了。

sentences.english: Perhaps the weather will change this evening.
In anticipation of bad weather they take plenty of warm clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他们预料到会变天而带了很多厚衣服。

definition: to trend/to get popular quickly/sudden heat wave (weather)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
lit. storm clouds approach/troubles lie ahead (idiom)
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to turn hostile suddenly/face changing, a device of Sichuan Opera, a dramatic change of attitude expressing fright, anger etc
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
omen/sign (that sth is about to happen)/warning sign
omen/sign (of sth yet to occur)/prior indication/to foreshadow
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
